# splitView

**Instance Property**

The split view that the split view controller manages.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var splitView: NSSplitView { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property gives you access to the split view controller’s split view for querying its attributes or customizing it.

By default, a split view arranges its child views vertically from top to bottom. To specify a horizontal (side-by-side) arrangement, implement the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitView/isVertical] property of the split view object to return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

Also by default, a split view has a divider style of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitView/DividerStyle-swift.enum/thin], and doesn’t have an autosave name.



To provide a custom split view, set this property at any time before you call `super` in the inherited [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/viewDidLoad()] method; that is, before the split view controller’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/isViewLoaded] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

The split view isn’t always the same object as that in the split view controller’s inherited [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSViewController/view] property. To access the split view, always use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSSplitViewController/splitView] property.

## Configuring and Managing a Split View Controller

- **splitViewItem(for:)**: Returns the corresponding split view item for the specified child view controller of the split view controller.
- **splitViewItems**: The array of split view items that correspond to the split view controller’s child view controllers.
- **NSSplitViewItem**: An item in a split view controller.
